text: my name is Jennifer Larson and our
company is hive digital mines and we are
the creators of school bus hype digital
Minds is focused on communications and
we've created school buzz as a solution
for k-12 schools to streamline how
schools share information with parents
what attracted us to AWS was a couple
things on the product and service side
really it was about getting to the cloud
and our development team you know we
looked at a couple different options and
we wanted to find a solution that they
were most comfortable with and felt kind
of matched up with where we were at on
the startup side second to that it was
kind of the resources and support that
would go along with it I'm a CEO but I'm
a marketing background so I needed to
make sure that we were picking a
solution that would also provide some of
those business and marketing resources
in addition to just kind of the software
support I enjoy being kind of in the
early stage of programs and it just felt
like we had a lot of access to great
people both on the Amazon side but also
there was a lot of entrepreneurs that I
met in those first couple of months so
got me really excited and quite honestly
even when I did the application for at
start just the questions that were being
asked that have a lot more of a customer
and business focus got me even more
excited that this was probably the right
program for us to start with we're in a
pilot phase right now so most of the
products and services we use are around
hosting the communications platform for
each of our schools where we want to
take it though over the next couple
years is using the machine learning to
build out a recommendation engine for
parents so that they're not just getting
pushed to them updates and assignments
but also other information that they may
not be aware is important to them and
getting some recommendations to them as
other things that they can be doing to
better support their kids
